page.title: 01 THE AREA IN GENERAL
page.content: The area covered by our rectangle is mainly rural and there is one main settlement,Betley,in the S.E.corner. The land is fairly flat and it is a mixture of pasture for milk and beef cattle,cereals and some potatoes.The average size of the farms 100-200 acres.There are some woods and many trees along roadsides making a pleasant and varied landscape.There are several public footpaths across the fields.There is one main road through Betley.The two nearst big towns are Crewe and Newcastle-Under-Lyme the main road goes to both of them. Betley was on a stage coach route and has many inns.It is still a very small village. There is a electrified railway going through the area it is the main line from London through Crewe to the North of England and Scotland.
